text: Draught at the brewery. Pours clear brown with ruby highlights and a small, frothy off-white head, short retention with no lacing. Aroma is cherries, oak, figs, caramel malt, alcohol, and plums. Flavor is dark fruits, caramel malt, alcohol, oak and a sweet finish. Full body and light carbonation.
Poured a lighter brown with a beige head. Aroma was of.barrel, caramel and.dark fruit. Flavor similar, but a bit boozy and.much.

On tap at Glacier brew house. 
This was poured into a wine glass. 
The appearance was a dark brown color with tinges of hazy reddish purple along the sides of the glass. 
The smell had a big boozy burst of brown sugar and sweet dark fruits. 
The taste copied the smell and confided in a sweet sticky caramel aftertaste and finish. 
On the palate, this one sat about a medium on the body with a pretty good sipping quality about it. Light vanilla rolled over my tongue nicely. 
Overall, I say this was a pretty good eisbock. The ABV is up there but doesnt hit you too hard.
On tap @ FoBAB 2014. Pour is cloudy brown with a very small khaki head. Aroma and flavor of burnt sugar, vanilla beans, roasted malt, charred oak, and caramel. Finish has some added peat and toffee.

(Draught) clear medium ruby brown, light clear offwhite edge bubbles. Nose of rum raisin, light whiskey, graham cracker, rich and pretty decadent. Taste of rich raisin, caramel, big whiskey barrel, a bit alcoholic but thats not a bad thing. Very true to style, quite good. As good as any Ive had.

Clear dark amber color with light tan head. Very nice fresh oak, toffee, brown sugar, dark bread aromas. medium body, soft carbonation. Oaky vanilla, brown sugar flavors with dark fruits, yeasty dark bread--most tasty bock brew
user_location: Same Trailer, Different Park, Louisiana, USA

text: Draft: Poured a deep dark brown with light brown edges. Aroma is bold fruit, boozy, and chocolate. Taste is strong woodsy booze, vanilla, fruit, and bourbon.

Sampled from the tap at FOBAB 2012. Pours a clear amber brown with a brown head that dissipates to the edges. Aroma is full of caramel and toffee with a decent amount of oak. Flavor starts sweet with caramel but mellows to more of a toffee and bread finish with a hint of oak.
Some very nice malt flavors are in thsi one. It comes out a bit unrefined but the oak helps it htough it is subtle.

UPDATED: DEC 20, 2015  Seems to be different from the regular eisbock, which is 10% abv and not barrel aged. Draft at the source. Hazy dark brown color, small white edge head. Aroma of vanilla and whiskey. Taste is chocolate covered caramel bonbons. Best tasting beer of the night.

On tap at Brouwers Big Wood. Pours black with a red tint. and a small off white bubbly head. Aroma of roasted malts, dark chocolate, toasted nuts and some caramel. Flavour of the same with some liqueur and vanilla. Full bodied, complex and lovely.

Snifter at brewhouse. Good aroma, Trace is strong. Sweet streak. Vanilla/ oak. Clean ruby brown color. No head or lace. Sweet flavor. Medium.body, oily creamy mouthfeel. Dry finish. Very nice, especially if you like buffalo trace. Flavor a tad better than aroma imo.
user_location: the Containment Area, North Carolina, USA

text: Aged in a Makers Mark barrel. Probably a different listing, but whatever, fuck it. Someone else can add it. Wonderful sweet nose of vanilla, bourbon, oak, brown sugar, chocolate, dark fruit. Really sweet, but really nice smelling. Pours brown with light red hues, thin head. Mostly hazy, opaque or whatever. Flavors of bourbon to start, brown bread, chocolate, dark fruits, vanilla, brown sugar, and light wood. Sweetness is balanced and rounded out. Not cloying at all. I am not a huge sweet beer fan but this worked wonderfully. Good shit here, no hint of 10%. Solid fucking stuff.

On tap at Brouwers for Big Wood, pours a deep dark amber / brown with a small tan head. Aroma of lager yeast, some wood, treacle and sugar. Flavour is very sweet, with cloying candied sugar sweetness, some herbal notes, lager yeast and minor woody notes. Cloyingly sweet with lingering candied sugar notes. Okay, but too sweet for me.

Draft @ FoBAB 2009, Chicago, IL. Pours a reddish brown color with a small off-white head. Has a sweetish malty toffee and caramel aroma with oaky hints. Sweetish malty toffee and dark fruit flavor with woody hints. Has a sweetish malty woody toffee finish.
Draft at Bistro BABF. Nose of oak, vanilla, raosty nuts, toffee, and raisins. Clear brown with a small tan head. Flavor of chocolate, oak, and raisins.

Had this on tap this past weekend at the Great Alaskan Beer and Barley Wine Festival in Anchorage, AK. Colour... amber-brown with no head. Nose... sweet, malty, light brown sugar. Palate... more sweet malt and brown sugar, toffee, slightly frothy, vanilla, marshmallow and a long finish.

Draft. Rich mahogony beer with a light tan head. Roasty, malty, and light caramel aroma. Caramel/toffee flavor with rich malt and some vanilla. Medium-plus bodied. Caramel and toffee lingers with some oak and vanilla.

On tap at the brewery. Pours a reddish brown with a very small light tan head. Aroma of plums, dates, caramel and a very light alcohol scent. Flavor is sweet and malty with some sour notes from the barrel. Medium to full body with a mild carbonation and long sweet finish. Very smooth Ice Bock that hides the alcohol well and isnt too sweet.

Tasted at the 4th Annual Bistro Barrel Aged Beer Fest on 11/14/2009. This Eisbock pours a medium brown color from the tap. Small sized white foamy head. The aroma is fruity and sweet, caramel and wood. A medium to full bodied eisbock. The malts are caramel and sweet. The hops are herbal and floral. There are a lot of different flavors going on here. Vanilla, wood, oak, nutty, malts all mix to make a very interesting beer. Mouthfeel is full and round. Finish is clean and smooth. Aftertaste is slightly sweet.

On tap at the Bistro Barrel Aged Fest in Hayward, CA.  Mostly clear dark reddish-brown in color with a medium-sized tan head and decent retention.  Aroma is caramel, oak, red wine, berries, and nuts.  Flavor is sweet, malty, and nutty, with lots of caramel and toffee, red wine, oak, vanilla, and some other fruity notes in there.  Smooth on the palate with medium body and soft carbonation.  Hell of a beer overall.  A bit underrated so far.

Draft @ Bistro Barrel Aged Festival. Pours a dark, reddish-brown color; light-tan head with patchy lacing. Loads of complex sugar, honey, and tempered sweetness in the aroma; light oak character; intricate sweetness. Relaxed carbonation; loads of sugar, solidly integrated maltiness, light vanilla and caramel and slight (seemingly) oxidation; nice beer. Lengthy finish of complex sugar, toasty vanilla and toasty malts; hidden alcohol.
pours ruby off white head. nose is caramelly, nutty. flavors is loaded with butterscotch, nutty, malty, odd brew.
